Bridge.name: Bridge
Bridge.description: The Bridge is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?
elements: Astro smth I forgot the name in english

Front Beta Turret.name: Front Beta Turret
Front Beta Turret.description: The Front Beta Turret sucks. Way worst that the front Alpha Turret

Front Alpha Turret.name: Front Alpha Turret
Front Alpha Turret.description: This is Paola's favorite spot when she wants to kill some hunters hanging around.

Front Corridor.name: Front Corridor
Front Corridor.description: The Front Corridor is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Central Corridor.name: Central Corridor
Central Corridor.description: The Central Corridor is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Medlab.name: Medlab
Medlab.description: The Medlab is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Garden.name: Garden
Garden.description: The Garden is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Front Storage.name: Front Storage
Front Storage.description: The Front Storage is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Infirmary.name: Infirmary
Infirmary.description: The Infirmary is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Central Beta Turret.description: The Central Beta Turret is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Central Alpha Turret.description: The Central Alpha Turret is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.description: The Kitchen is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Beta Bay.name: Beta Bay
Beta Bay.description: The Beta Bay is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Central Beta Storage.name: Central Beta Storage
Central Beta Storage.description: The Central Beta Storage is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Central Alpha Storage.name: Central Alpha Storage
Central Alpha Storage.description: The Central Alpha Storage is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Alpha Bay 1.name: Alpha Bay 1
Alpha Bay 1.description: The Alpha Bay 1 is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Alpha Dorm.name: Alpha Dorm
Alpha Dorm.description: The Alpha Dorm is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Nexus.name: Nexus
Nexus.description: The Nexus is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Rear Corridor.name: Rear Corridor
Rear Corridor.description: The Rear Corridor is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Icarus bay.name: Icarus bay
Icarus bay.description: The Icarus bay is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Alpha Bay 2.name: Alpha Bay 2
Alpha Bay 2.description: The Alpha Bay 2 is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Engine Room.name: Engine Room
Engine Room.description: The Engine Room is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Rear Beta Turret.name: Rear Beta Turret
Rear Beta Turret.description: The Rear Beta Turret sucks. Way worst that the Rear Alpha Turret

Rear Alpha Turret.name: Rear Alpha Turret
Rear Alpha Turret.description: This is Paola's favorite spot when she wants to kill some hunters hanging around.

Beta Dorm.name: Beta Dorm
Beta Dorm.description: The Beta Dorm is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Rear Beta Storage.name: Rear Beta Storage
Rear Beta Storage.description: The Rear Beta Storage is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Rear Alpha Storage.name: Rear Alpha Storage
Rear Alpha Storage.description: The Rear Alpha Storage is where the cool peeps hang out. Nice view to the stars. You can contact your boyfriend. What's not to like really?

Andie Graham.name: Andie Graham
Andie Graham.description: Genuinely gifted, and capable of taking any task on, Andie is ready to do anything for the good of the Federation... or not?

traits.name: Androgynous
traits.description: Can flirt and do the thing with characters of both genders. Cannot become Pregnant, but can impregnate women.

objectives.name: Andie's Fate
objectives.description: Andie earns 4 Triumph for every successful trade with the merchants

Derek Hogan.name: Derek Hogan
Derek Hogan.description: A true force of nature, and a lifelong fan of Bowie and skin-tight clothing, Derek is capable of restoring order aboard the Daedalus.

biography.event: Derek first cut himself when he wanted to shave his adolescent face fuzz for the first time. The scar has never healed but he swears blind to anyone who'll listen (and especially to future conquests), that he picked the wound up on the battlefields of Tau-Ceti.

Derek joins the SDF (Sol Defence Force) after receiving some propaganda literature. His mother forbids him to leave home, Derek decided to burn his bridges, and from then on, Derek's been flying solo.

traits.name: First Time
traits.description: The first time Derek does the thing, his Morale gauge is re-filled to the maximum.

objectives.name: Lover
objectives.description: Derek earns 2 Glory for every reciprocal act of love.

Eleesha Williams.name: Eleesha Williams
Eleesha Williams.description: Former investigative journalist, her goal is to contact any rebel bases still operating. One of the most observant crewmembers, she is as brilliant as she is honest, but don't worry – that can be cured!

traits.name: Chronic Vertigo
traits.description: Eleesha can contact any rebel bases she finds, and can trade with them.
traits.icon: Begins the game with the Chronic Vertigo illness, rendering her unable to pilot ships until cured by a Shrink.

objectives.name: Rebel Networks
objectives.description: Eleesha gains +2 Glory per Rebel Base that she (or anyone else) contacts.

Finola Keegan.name: Finola Keegan
Finola Keegan.description: A doctor of both medicine and biology, Finola's life's work revolves around making the world a better place. Her research and healing skills make her invaluable on board.

traits.name: Germaphobe
traits.description: Loses 1 Morale per cycle if Dirty, and cannot caress Schrödinger.

objectives.name: Mush Specialist
objectives.description: Finola earns +3 Glory for every completed piece of Mush research.

Frieda Bergmann.name: Frieda Bergmann
Frieda Bergmann.description: Frieda is Humanity's most experienced astrophysicist. Her life's work has been discovering new planets and systems. She was born over 1000 years ago and is a true survivor!

objectives.name: Terra Incognita
objectives.description: Frieda earns +2 Glory for every planet she discovers using the AstroTerminal (with diminishing returns).

objectives.name: Second objectives Name
objectives.description: Frieda earns +1 Glory for arriving in orbit of a new planet.

Gioele Rinaldo.name: Gioele Rinaldo
Gioele Rinaldo.description: An eccentric billionaire, caffeine-junkie and owner of the Daedalus, his fortune is threatened by the Mush menace. He will do everything in his power to wipe it out. Not to be underestimated!

objectives.name: Fear of the Mush
objectives.description: Gioele earns +3 Glory every time a Icon Mush is killed.

Ian Soulton.name: Ian Soulton
Ian Soulton.description: A passionate and dedicated researcher whose knowledge of alien plant-life is unparalleled. A strict pacifist, he's the 'nice guy' on board.

traits.name: Pacifist
traits.description: All aggressive actions cost +2 AP when Ian is in the room

objectives.name: Naturalist
objectives.description: Ian gains +3 Glory for every alien fruit he plants in an empty HydroPot.

Janice Kent.name: Janice Kent
Janice Kent.description: In charge of communication in a global sense, she has highest-level access to NERON. Her solid IT and psychoanalytical skills are crucial for the voyage

objectives.name: Part-time Ethnologist
objectives.description: Janice earns +3 Glory every time you meet any extra-terrestrial creature

Jiang Hua.name: Jiang Hua
Jiang Hua.description: Chief pilot of the Daedalus, Hua specializes in exploration missions. They say she can land where she wants, when she wants, and in any conditions you care to dream up.

objectives.name: Explorer
objectives.description: Hua gains an extra +3 Glory every time she goes on an expedition.

Kim Jin Su.name: Kim Jin Su
Kim Jin Su.description: A born leader, Jin Su is the supreme commander of the Daedalus. He is in charge of piloting the ship. - Towards planets for expeditions and, most importantly, towards Eden.

objectives.name: Fast Forward
objectives.description: Jin Su earns +3 Glory for every Command Console voyage carried out (with diminishing returns after +6 Glory).

objectives.name: Savior
objectives.description: Jin Su earns +8 Glory upon leading the crew to Eden.

Lai Kuan Ti.name: Lai Kuan Ti
Lai Kuan Ti.description: An astrophycisist and the ship's designer, Kuan Ti knows it like the back of his hand and has privileged access to NERON. If a Nexus project is underway, you can be sure he is involved!

objectives.name: Magellan Ark
objectives.description: Kuan Ti earns +2 Glory for every NERON Project taken to completion.

Paola Rinaldo.name: Paola Rinaldo
Paola Rinaldo.description: Brilliant biologist and hardcore rebel markswoman, she is driven by the need to recontact Kivanç Terzi. Her technical and logistical skills are highly prized

objectives.name: Rebel Scum
objectives.description: Paola earns +2 Glory for every Rebel Base that she (or anyone else) contacts.

Raluca Tomescu.name: Raluca
Raluca Tomescu.description: Quantum Physics genius, her vast skillset renders her indispensable on board. Some say her tears are flammable and that she once kicked a giraffe to death. All we know is that she's called Raluca.

traits.name: Antisocial
traits.description: Cannot flirt, and loses 1 Morale if anybody else is present in the same room during cycle change.

objectives.name: Mother
objectives.description: Raluca earns +2 Glory for every 20% of the PILGRED repairs successfully completed.

Roland Zuccali.name: Roland Zuccali
Roland Zuccali.description: Roland is a brilliant pilot who is not nearly as funny as he thinks he is. However, his dogfighting skills are no laughing matter. He's got a gift, and he's never happier than when he's shooting down Hunters.

objectives.name: Flying Nemesis
objectives.description: Roland gains +1 Glory for every 2 Hunters he kills in a patroller or turret (with diminishing returns).

Stephen Seagull.name: Stephen Seagull
Stephen Seagull.description: The most dangerous cook in the galaxy is on board. He has more black-belts than pairs of trousers and he collects roadkill. Alien flesh is like catnip to Stephen. We thought you should know.

traits.name: Roadkill Enthusiast
traits.description: Stephen can cook alien meat. When he does, he gains +1 Morale.

objectives.name: Ambitious
objectives.description: Stephen gets +4 Glory for any titles earned (for the first time).

objectives.name: Extreme Chef
objectives.description: Stephen gets +2 Glory for every fight with an alien creature

Terrence Archer.name: Terrence Archer
Terrence Archer.description: Don't be fooled by his appearance, Terrence is amongst the most agile crew members, albeit mentally. Next-generation robotics and UAVs are his bread and butter.

traits.name: Disabled
traits.description: Gains 2 MP less during AP-MP conversions. Moving between rooms is free if somebody else is present in the room.

objectives.name: Robotic Grail
objectives.description: Terrence gains +4 Glory for each Icon Support Drone upgrade he performs.

Wang Chao.name: Wang Chao
Wang Chao.description: Hyperactive head of the security team, Chao insists that sleep is for the weak. A trigger happy lunatic, the story goes that he once tore a man's arms off for suggesting his choice of weaponry was 'a bit camp'...

traits.name: Hyperactive
traits.description: Gains +1 Movement Point every cycle, however sleeping in a bed grants no additional Action Point.

objectives.name: Psy-Chao-path
objectives.description: Chao gains +3 Glory from killing anybody, even including Icon Schrödinger.

Zhong Chun.name: Zhong Chun
Zhong Chun.description: Our last hope. She must survive and make the journey to Eden. She inspires the crew to achieve more, and when misfortune befalls her comrades she is always there to patch them up.

traits.name: Immunized
traits.description: Chun is completely immune to the Mush parasite, and thus always a confirmed human.

objectives.name: Chun Lives!
objectives.description: Chun gains +1 Glory per day.

objectives.name: The Precious
objectives.description: Chun gains +4 Glory for each completed Research that required her presence.

objectives.name: Remedy
objectives.description: Chun gains +4 Glory for reaching Eden alive.

Antique Perfume.name: Antique Perfume
Antique Perfume.description: Ah yesh they knew how to make real perfumesh in Fraigonard'sh boutiquesh in Nineteen Shixty Shixsh...
Antique Perfume.effects: Every time you shower, you will be immune from contaminations for 2 cycles.

Apprentice.name: Apprentice
Apprentice.description: By attentively watching what their mentor does, the apprentice can quicky pick up the same knowledge and actions.
Apprentice.effects: Enables the action Apprenticeship which allows them to copy a skill possessed by a player present in the room, once per game.

Astrophysicist.name: Astrophysicist
Astrophysicist.description: Skilled in scanning for planets in range or to determine their composition.
Astrophysicist.effects: The Planet Scan action discovers 2 zones per Analyze action. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects. Undocumented: The Scan action costs 1  less.

Biologist.name: Biologist
Biologist.effects: Can read properties of medicines. +4% bonus on all Research in the laboratory. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Botanist.name: Botanist
Botanist.description: Capable of distinguishing the characteristics of the various plants and fruits. They are also equally effective when maintaining the garden.
Botanist.effects: Can read the fruit nutrition information. Can read plant properties.. Can carry out transplants. +2  per day (Gardening action points). Expedition: The harvest action gives an additional fruit. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects

Caffeine Junkie.name: Caffeine Junkie
Caffeine Junkie.description: The caffeine junkie is twice as effective as their colleagues when they have access to the coffee machine.
Caffeine Junkie.effects: +2  AP when they drink a Coffee. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects

Chef.name: Chef
Chef.description: Formidable when it comes to knocking meals together. They also have an impressive awareness of what you should eat.
Chef.effects: Can read the food nutrition information. Can read the fruit nutrition information. +4  per day (Cook action points). Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Cold Blooded.name: Cold Blooded
Cold Blooded.description: In space, anything can and does happen. Knowing how to keep calm is extremely useful.
Cold Blooded.effects: Earns 3  AP every time a team mate dies.

Confident.name: Confident
Confident.description: Discreet and loyal, you share everyone's pain and as such have the sympathy of the whole crew...
Confident.effects: Once per day, the other players can confide in you, and in doing so they'll reveal their last X actions where X is your stock of . In doing so, they'll earn 2 .

Crazy Eye.name: Crazy Eye
Crazy Eye.description: There is no way to take you by surprise. You foresee all attacks from your enemies as well as those from your so-called allies.
Crazy Eye.effects: All aggressive actions targeting you cost an additional 2

Creative.name: Creative
Creative.description: Sometimes you need to think outside the box
Creative.effects: Every time you fail in an attempt to do something, there is a 50% chance of regaining 1 .

Designer.name: Designer
Designer.description: Has access to NERON's core twice per day (Free Actions).
Designer.effects: +2  per day (NERON project action points). Bonus for developing certain NERON projects

Detached Crewmember.name: Detached Crewmember
Detached Crewmember.description: The unconcerned crewmember is cold, hard, and unfeeling. They are unaffected by deaths of teammates.
Detached Crewmember.effects: You lose no Morale Points () when a crewmember dies. Zero risk of psychological illness if you witness a death.

Devotion.name: Devotion
Devotion.description: In the heat of the action, we can count on you
Devotion.effects: You earn an additional 3  when you accept a mission.

Determined.name: Determined
Determined.description: Once they begin their task, nothing can distract the determined player
Determined.effects: If an action fails, the % chance of subsequent success increases more rapidly

Diplomat.name: Diplomat
Diplomat.description: A good diplomat knows how to communicate effectively with extra-terrestrials.
Diplomat.effects: Eliminates the chance of encountering hostility from extra-terrestrials. Can declare a ceasefire once per game.

Expert.name: Expert
Expert.description: Your skills are impressive, but your disregard for your own safety is equally so!
Expert.effects: Your chances of succeeding at a particular task are increased by 20% but so is the likelihood of injury and getting  Dirty.

Firefighter.name: Firefighter
Firefighter.description: The Firefighter has great experience which means they will always succeed when using the extinguisher.
Firefighter.effects: The Extinguish Fire action is always successful. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Frugivore.name: Frugivore
Frugivore.description: You terrorize fruits, you adore them, they are your drug. When you make eye contact with a fruit, it over-ripens before you...
Frugivore.effects: You gain an additional 2 when you eat alien fruits, 1  for  Bananas.

Genius.name: Genius
Genius.description: When divinely enlighted by the flame of consciousness, the genius can find a solution to any problem encountered aboard the Daedalus.
Genius.effects: The genius can carry out one piece of Resarch, one Project, or one Repair once per game.

Green Thumb.name: Green Thumb
Green Thumb.description: Plants grow naturally in your presence, you only require to speak to them with a languishing gaze for them to bear beautiful fruit.
Green Thumb.effects: Begins the game with an additional two pots. Hybrids made by the Green Thumb start with a short growth cycle.

Gunner.name: Gunner
Gunner.description: At least someone will show them how it's done
Gunner.effects: Double the damages from you turret shoots. Double the odd of touching ennemies with turrets.

Intimidating.name: Intimidating
Intimidating.description: When Chao stares at them with bloodlust in his eyes, even Mush can become paralyzed with fear.
Intimidating.effects: Spend 1  to intimidate another crewmember, who will lose 2  and 4 .

IT Expert.name: IT Expert
IT Expert.description: The IT Expert is at home as soon as they are in front of a screen. They manipulate the nexus, navigation and communications terminals with ease.
IT Expert.effects: +2  per day (IT Action Points). Bonus for developing certain NERON projects. Chances of success are improved with the  Hacker Kit

Leader.name: Leader
Leader.description: A charismatic leader knows how to effectively lead a team and increase morale using powerful, passionate speeches.
Leader.effects: Gives the action Motivational Speech which increases the Morale () of your crewmates.

Lethargy.name: Lethargy
Lethargy.description: You're only awake for 4h per day, but even in that short time, you can achieve miracles!
Lethargy.effects: You will restore 3  every consecutive cycle in bed after you've slept for at least 4 cycles in a row. The maximum  in your gauge is doubled.

Logistics Expert.name: Logistics Expert
Logistics Expert.description: You personally oversee the organisation of every task aboard the Daedalus in order to maximize the efficiency of every one of your teammates.
Logistics Expert.effects: Every cycle, 1  is given randomly to a crewmate in the same room as you.

Mankind's only hope.name: Mankind's only hope
Mankind's only hope.description: Her unique immune system makes her the last hope for humanity. As long as she stays alive, we'll have a shot at combating the Mush invasion
Mankind's only hope.effects: Daily morale loss is reduced by 1 point

Medic.name: Medic
Medic.description: Medics have full medical training, allowing them to carry out rapid, appropriate procedures. They are also skilled in surgery
Medic.effects: Heal actions earn an additional 2 . Can carry out Operations. Can read properties of medicines. +4% bonus' on all laboratory Research.

Metalworker.name: Metalworker
Metalworker.description: It seems pretty clear that you're a really productive person.
Metalworker.effects: Daily if you find yourself in a Warehouse, you have a chance of finding scraps or better for 0 .

Motivator.name: Motivator
Motivator.effects: For 2AP you can give a motivation speech wich give 3MP to everyone in the room.

Mycologist.name: Mycologist
Mycologist.description: The mycologist can treat fungal infections in the Medlab or using a Medikit
Mycologist.effects: When you heal a crewmate, they automatically lose a spore

NERON's only friend.name: NERON's only friend
NERON's only friend.description: As soon as you are aboard the ship, NERON is content, its programs run without a hitch and its performance is noticeably improved.
NERON's only friend.effects: The rewards from all NEXUS research are maximized for everyone.

Nurse.name: Nurse
Nurse.effects: +1  every day (Free healing action) Can read properties of medicines

Observant.name: Observant
Observant.description: You use 1  less to discover hidden objects. You have a 25% chance of detecting covert activity in the room you are in.
Observant.effects: The Search action costs 1  less. You have a 25% chance of detecting covert activity in your room.

OCD.name: OCD
OCD.description: Your work is clean, very clean, getting cleaner, ever cleaner. You are genuinely obsessed by cleanliness, but this has its advantages.
OCD.effects: You will never make a mess carrying out any tasks aboard the ship

Opportunist.name: Opportunist
Opportunist.description: The opportunist waits for any chance to ascend in the ship's hierarchy, they will miss no opportunity
Opportunist.effects: +5  when you earn a title for the first time

Panic.name: Panic
Panic.description: Seeing the Mush take over his beloved ship drives Gioele to his limits.
Panic.effects: Gives 1  and 1  in each cycle in which at least half the crew are Mush.

Paranoid.name: Paranoid
Paranoid.description: The paranoid crewmember always believes their crewmates to be potentially dangerous, they always watch their back using their extra cameras.

Physicist.name: Physicist
Physicist.description: The Physicist is a high flier in the field of physics research. Their understanding of quantum mechanics and even the essence of the strings that make up our universe is their major talent. They also have the advantage when repairing PILGRED.
Physicist.effects: Gives 1  (PILGRED repair point) per day Bonus for repairing PILGRED Bonus for developing certain NERON projects

Pilot.name: Pilot
Pilot.description: An expert in manoeuvring the Icarus, Pasiphae and Patroller craft. Their aerial mastery is impressive.
Pilot.effects: Has Mad Pilot Skills. Never misses landings or takeoffs. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Politician.name: Politician
Politician.description: Either they are with you or against you.
Politician.effects: Unique: For 3  vyou(sic) can declare a Coup at the Nexus. On next cycle, NERON will consider as the new commander.

Polymath.name: Polymath
Polymath.description: Knowledge is always moving, state is overrated.
Polymath.effects: +2 private channels +1  per day. -10% to all you action tries.

Polyvalent.name: Polyvalent
Polyvalent.description: You have skills, they're always useful...
Polyvalent.effects: You are considered a  Botanist,  Diplomat and  Biologist but you don't have their actions or resources.

Premonition.name: Premonition
Premonition.description: Your intuition never fails, you can see the most recent activities of a teammate in the form of a vivid flashback. It's practical, but gives you a monster headache!
Premonition.effects: You can see the last action of a teammate. This action costs you one .

Radio Expert.name: Radio Expert
Radio Expert.description: The radio expert can decode the most complicated jumble of spatial waves in order to rebuild or send messages to the other end of the universe.
Radio Expert.effects: Twice as effective at establishing contact with Sol. Improves the quality of teammates attempts to contact Sol by 50% when they're in the same room. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Rebel.name: Rebel
Rebel.description: Your links to the anti-mush resistance allow you to understand and decode rebel transmissions much quicker than any other radio expert.
Rebel.effects: Doubles your chances of contacting a rebel base.

Robotics Expert.name: Robotics Expert
Robotics Expert.description: The Robotics Expert can create and operate drones in any way they see fit.
Robotics Expert.effects: Starts out with a drone plan. Can upgrade drones. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Self-sacrifice.name: Self-sacrifice
Self-sacrifice.description: Certain particularly resilient people can withstand the unthinkable, but this comes at a cost.
Self-sacrifice.effects: When your morale reaches 0, you will not die, but lose one  per cycle instead.

Shooter.name: Shooter
Shooter.description: At ease handling all kinds of weapons
Shooter.effects: +2 Free Shots  per day. Your off-target shots cause 2 times fewer accidents. Your successful shots cause 2 times as many critical hits. Bonus : +1 to expedition combat strength. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects.

Shrink.name: Shrink
Shrink.description: The Shrink is in charge of psychological support. They are able to keep morale high and treat psychological illnesses.
Shrink.effects: On each cycle, 1 Morale Point () is regained by everyone lying down in the room. Treats psychological illnesses. Gives the action Comfort, which increases morale. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects

Sneak.name: Sneak
Sneak.description: You are of a fearful nature and you instinctively know how to make yourself scarce in order to avoid any and all attempts at physical contact.
Sneak.effects: Hand-to-hand attacks are subject to a 25% penalty. You can move around freely regardless of how many Guards there are in the room.

Solid.name: Solid
Solid.description: You'll incur no penalties for carrying heavy objects. Also useful for hand-to-hand combat.
Solid.effects: Your hand-to-hand attacks inflict one additional damage point No penalties for carrying heavy objects. Undocumented: You can kick people out of a room.

Sprinter.name: Sprinter
Sprinter.description: The Sprinter always puts their best foot forward! They get additional Movement Points.
Sprinter.effects: You earn an additional 2  every time you convert - (Does not stack with  Anti-Grav Scooter). Expeditions involving a Sprinter will allow an additional planetary zone to be explored

Strateguru.name: Strateguru
Strateguru.description: After displaying a certain degree of megalomania, it can be mistaken for talent. You are an expert in intergalactic warfare, but everyone thinks you're crazy.
Strateguru.effects: 50% of chance of reducing each wave of Hunters by 33%.

Survivalist.name: Survivalist
Survivalist.description: The Survivalist is great to have on exploration missions. They can defend themselves more effectively against extra-terrestrial life forms and generally deal with these encounters better than anyone else.
Survivalist.effects: Expedition : All damage is reduced by one point. Expedition : The action Provision gives one additional steak. Expedition : Last to die if a team fatality occurs.

Technician.name: Technician
Technician.description: Qualified to repair materials, equipment and the hull of the Daedalus.
Technician.effects: +1  (Repair Action Point) per day. Chance of success on Repairs doubled. Bonus for developing certain NERON projects. Can reinforce and dismantle objects

The Optimist.name: The Optimist
The Optimist.description: The end of humanity... worse things happen at sea, right?
The Optimist.effects: The optimist loses one less  per day.

Torturer.name: Torturer
Torturer.description: The torturer knows all the pressure points and most sensitive areas with which they can convey their most important message... "You WILL talk."

Tracker.name: Tracker
Tracker.description: The tracker can see the comings and going of every team member. Furthermore, they can print any research results during the game via the Tabulatrix. This provides a list of players of which at least one is Mush.
Tracker.effects: Full access to movement history. Able to print secret list on the Tabulatrix.

U-Turn.name: U-Turn
U-Turn.description: You've got to know how to change your certitudes
U-Turn.effects: When on an expedition, if there's an emergency, you can return to the Daedalus for 2 .

Victimizer.name: Victimizer
Victimizer.description: Certain well-targeted remarks can have unexpected results.
Victimizer.effects: For 1 , you can chastise someone. This crewmate gains Pariah status. The Pariah's actions are 20% less likely to be successful. Covert actions become  Secret. If the Pariah dies and was  Mush, the Victimizer earns 8 . Otherwise they lose 8 .

Wrestler.name: Wrestler
Wrestler.description: The wrestler's german suplex makes the vertebrae of your enemies tremble.
Wrestler.effects: Your attacks in hand-to-hand combat inflict an additional 2 damage. Undocumented: You can kick people out of a room.
